questions.q: List at least three operating system services that are useful to users.
options: User interface, program execution, and I/O operations
questions.explanation: These services allow users to interact with the computer and run their tasks easily.

questions.q: List at least three operating system functions that maintain efficient operation of the system.
questions.explanation: These background functions ensure that the hardware is used fairly and securely.

questions.q: What are the two different approaches for providing a user interface?
options: Command-Line Interface (CLI) and Graphical User Interface (GUI)
questions.explanation: CLI uses text commands, while GUI uses icons and mouse interactions.

questions.q: What is a system call?
options: A programmatic way to request services from the OS kernel
questions.explanation: System calls are the interface between a running program and the operating system.

questions.q: What is an API?
questions.explanation: An API provides a set of functions that are easier for programmers to use than direct system calls.

questions.q: What kernel data structure can be used for one technique of passing parameters to system calls?
questions.explanation: Parameters can be pushed onto a stack by the program and popped off by the operating system.

questions.q: List at least three of the major categories of system calls.
options: Process control, file management, and device management
questions.explanation: Other categories include information maintenance and communications.

questions.q: A program that has been loaded and executing is called a _____.
questions.explanation: A process is a unit of work in a modern time-sharing system.

questions.q: What part of the operating system makes the decision with regards to which job will run?
questions.explanation: The OS must choose which jobs to load and run to maintain efficiency.

questions.q: List at least three of the categories of system programs.
options: File manipulation, status information, and programming-language support
questions.explanation: System programs provide a convenient environment for program development and execution.

questions.q: True or False? The view most users see of the OS is defined by application and system programs rather than system calls.
questions.explanation: True.  Most users interact with shells or desktops, not the raw system call interface.

questions.q: What are the two basic goal groups that must be considered when designing an OS?
questions.explanation: User goals focus on convenience, while system goals focus on efficiency and reliability.

questions.q: What is the difference between policy and mechanism?
options: Mechanism determines how to do something; Policy determines what will be done
questions.explanation: Separating these allows for greater flexibility in changing how a system behaves.

questions.q: List at least three different ways for structuring an operating system.
options: Simple structure, layered approach, and microkernels
questions.explanation: Modern systems often use modules or hybrid structures.

questions.q: List at least two different hybrid operating systems.
questions.explanation: These systems combine different architectural styles like Mach microkernel and BSD Unix.

questions.q: What are the two devices that run the iOS operating system?
questions.explanation: iOS is the mobile OS designed by Apple specifically for these touch devices.

questions.q: What technique do microkernels use to communicate between services?
questions.explanation: Since services run in user space, they communicate by sending messages through the kernel.

questions.q: Provide an example of an operating system that uses the simple structure.
questions.explanation: MS-DOS did not have well-defined layers, allowing applications to access hardware directly.

questions.q: True or False? Performance tuning is a type of debugging.
questions.explanation: True.  Debugging can include finding bottlenecks to improve system performance.

questions.q: True or False? DTrace is available for Windows systems.
questions.explanation: False.  DTrace is a facility for dynamic tracing on Solaris, FreeBSD, and macOS, but not natively Windows.

questions.q: What does the term SYSGEN refer to?
questions.explanation: SYSGEN is the process of configuring the OS for a specific computer site.

questions.q: What is the name of the small piece of code that locates the kernel and loads it into main memory?
questions.explanation: This code is stored in ROM and runs when the computer is powered on.
